com.ansca.corona
Class CoronaRuntimeTaskDispatcher

java.lang.Object
  com.ansca.corona.CoronaRuntimeTaskDispatcher

public class CoronaRuntimeTaskDispatcher
extends java.lang.Object

Allows you to send tasks to be executed on the Corona runtime's thread, just before Corona renders a frame. These tasks provide thread safe access to the Corona runtime and its Lua state.

The main intention of this class is to provide a means for other threads to invoke Lua functions or manipulate Lua global variables belonging to the Corona runtime's Lua state. This is done by implementing the Lua state manipulation code within a CoronaRuntimeTask object and then sending that task object to the Corona runtime via this class' send() method. This class will handle this in a thread safe manner and make sure that the task object is executed on the Corona runtime's thread, just before it renders a frame.

Instances of this class are immutable.

See Also:
CoronaRuntime, CoronaRuntimeTask

Constructor Detail

CoronaRuntimeTaskDispatcher

public CoronaRuntimeTaskDispatcher(CoronaRuntime runtime)
Creates a new dispatcher which will send tasks to the given Corona runtime.

Parameters:
runtime - Reference to the Corona runtime that this dispatcher will send tasks to.

Setting this to null is allowed, but will create a dispatcher that is permanently inactive.

The created dispatcher will also be permanently inactive if the given Corona runtime has already been disposed/destroyed, which you can check by calling the runtime's wasDiposed() method. The runtime will be disposed when its associated Corona activity has been destroyed.

You can check if the created dispatcher is capable of sending tasks to the targeted Corona runtime by calling its isRuntimeAvailable() method.

CoronaRuntimeTaskDispatcher

public CoronaRuntimeTaskDispatcher(LuaState luaState)
Creates a new dispatcher which will send tasks to the Corona runtime that owns the given Lua state.

Parameters:
luaState - Reference to the Lua state that is owned by the Corona runtime that you want to target.

Setting this to null is allowed, but will create a dispatcher that is permanently inactive.

The created dispatcher will also be permanently inactive if the Lua state does not belong to an existing Corona runtime, such as one that has already been disposed/destroyed.

You can check if the created dispatcher is capable of sending tasks to the targeted Corona runtime by calling its isRuntimeAvailable() method.

Method Detail

isRuntimeAvailable

public boolean isRuntimeAvailable()
Determines if the targeted Corona runtime is still available for this dispatcher to send tasks to.

Returns:
Returns true if the Corona runtime is still available for this dispatcher to send tasks to.

Returns false if the Corona runtime has been disposed/destroyed, which happens when its associated Corona activity has been destroyed. This permanently disables this dispatcher.

isRuntimeUnavailable

public boolean isRuntimeUnavailable()
Determines if the targeted Corona runtime is permanently unavailable, meaning that this dispatcher no longer has a Corona runtime to send tasks to.

Returns:
Returns true if the Corona runtime has been disposed/destroyed, which happens when its associated Corona activity has been destroyed. This permanently disables this dispatcher.

Returns false if the Corona runtime is still available.

send

public void send(CoronaRuntimeTask task)
Sends the given task to the Corona runtime to be executed just before it renders a frame. This task will be executed on the same thread that the Corona runtime runs in.

The main intent of this method is to allow another thread to call a Lua function or manipulate a global variable in the Lua state on the same thread that Lua is running in.

Tasks will be executed by the Corona runtime in the order that they were sent by this method.

Parameters:
task - The task to be executed by the Corona runtime. Setting this to null will cause an exception to be thrown.
